data.title: Victor Spinetti
data.text:
AKA Vittorio Giorgio Andrea Spinetti

Born: 2-Sep-1933

Birthplace: Abergavenny, Monmouthshire, Wales

Died: 19-Jun-2012

Location of death: Monmouth, Wales

Cause of death: Cancer - Prostate

Gender: Male

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Gay

Occupation: Actor

Nationality: Wales

Executive summary: Oh! What A Lovely War

Father: Giuseppe Spinetti

Mother: Lily Watson

Brother: Henry Anthony George Spinetti (drummer, b. 31-Mar-1951)

Boyfriend: Graham Curnow (d. 1997)

High School: Monmouth School

Conservatory: Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama

Tony 1965 Oh, What a Lovely War (supporting actor in musical)

Italian Ancestry Paternal

TELEVISION

An Actor's Life for Me Desmond Shaw (1991)

Kelly Monteith (1979-82)

Two in Clover Vic Evans (1969-70)

FILMOGRAPHY AS ACTOR

In the Beginning (12-Nov-2000)

The Princess and the Goblin (14-Aug-1993) [VOICE]

The Krays (13-Sep-1990) · Mr. Lawson

The Attic: The Hiding of Anne Frank (17-Apr-1988)

Under the Cherry Moon (2-Jul-1986) · The Jaded Three

Mistral's Daughter (24-Sep-1984)

The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe (1-Apr-1979) [VOICE]

Casanova & Co. (1-Mar-1977)

Fiona (Mar-1977)

Voyage of the Damned (22-Dec-1976)

The Return of the Pink Panther (21-May-1975) · Hotel Concierge

The Little Prince (7-Nov-1974) · The Historian

The Great McGonagall (1974)

Digby, the Biggest Dog in the World (Dec-1973)

The 500 Pound Jerk (2-Jan-1973) · Martin Bloore

Under Milk Wood (27-Jan-1972)

Start the Revolution Without Me (4-Feb-1970)

Can Hieronymus Merkin Ever Forget Mercy Humppe and Find True Happiness? (19-Mar-1969)

The Biggest Bundle of Them All (17-Jan-1968)

Magical Mystery Tour (26-Dec-1967)

The Taming of the Shrew (27-Feb-1967) · Hortensio

Help! (29-Jul-1965)

A Hard Day's Night (6-Jul-1964)

The Wild Affair (Dec-1963)

Sparrows Can't Sing (26-Mar-1963)

Author of books:

Victor Spinetti Up Front: His Strictly Confidential Autobiography (2006, memoir)
